intro: Echites harrisii, commonly known as the Harris's echites, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
